required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Delayed or Direct Ureteroscopy in the Treatment of Pediatric Calcular Anuria
clinical_study.official_title: Staged Ureteroscopy After Initial Urinary Drainage Versus Direct Ureteroscopy in the Treatment of Pediatric Obstructive Calcular Anuria

brief_summary.textblock: To compare staged ureteroscopy following initial urinary drainage versus direct ureteroscopy without initial urinary drainage in the treatment of obstructive calcular anuria with acute renal failure in children.

detailed_description.textblock: To compare staged ureteroscopy following initial urinary drainage and stabilization of renal functions using percutaneous nephrostomy or double J stent versus direct ureteroscopy without initial urinary drainage in the treatment of obstructive calcular anuria with acute renal failure due to ureteric calculi in children.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: period for return to normal creatinine in both groups
success in removal of ureteric stones using ureteroscopy

primary_outcome.measure: operative and early post operative complications
primary_outcome.description: Hematuria, Extravasation (perforation), mucosal complications, stone migration, failure of ureteric access, fever

secondary_outcome.description: occurrence of ureteric stricture as a delayed complication

secondary_outcome.measure: period to reach stone free status bilaterally
secondary_outcome.description: period to reach stone free status bilaterally after the treatment of the contralateral side

secondary_outcome.measure: number of times of exposure to general anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: number of times of exposure to general anesthesia during successive interventions to clear stones bilaterally

arm_group.description: initial urinary drainage to stabilize renal functions before ureteroscopy
direct ureteroscopy without initial urinary drainage

intervention.description: initial urinary drainage is done using nephrostomy or double J stent to stabilize renal functions. this is followed several days later by definitive ureteroscopy.

direct ureteroscopy is done without initial urinary drainage and before return to normal chemistry. this is followed follow-up of renal functions for several days before treatment of the contralateral side.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- children â‰¤12 years old presenting with Obstructive Anuria and Acute Renal Failure due to bilateral ureteric stones suitable for ureteroscopy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Fever, pyonephrosis or sepsis.
- unstable patients are stabilized first by dialysis.
